creator: bronagh.mcelduff@mobilecohesion.com
text:
Version 2.1.20050531

The current implemenation of the webservice sampler simply gets the XML text and
creates a DOM document and passes it to Apache SOAP. It currently doesn't
support substitution of the xml with variables.

It would be a huge advantage to be able to substitute web service XML elements
with values extracted from external datafiles.

I was talking to mike about this and user variables should get replaced. I'm not
sure why it isn't. I noticed in the sample test plan you sent me, you're using a
combination of functions + user variables.  Have you tried using just variables
or just a function?

I'm starting to think it might be the combination of the two that is causing it.
I hope to find some time this weekend to look into this.

peter

creator: sebb@apache.org
text:
Fixed in 2.1 branch - input fields should now allow variables and functions.

There is no support for replacing variables/functions in external files in any 
JMeter test elements.

Nightly build dated 14-Feb-2006 10:14 should contain the fix; please report if 
OK

(In reply to comment #3)
> Fixed in 2.1 branch - input fields should now allow variables and functions.

Scrap that - the fix did nothing; input fields already supported these.

> There is no support for replacing variables/functions in external files in any 
> JMeter test elements.
> 

This is still true. Sorry.
creator: sebb@apache.org

text:
I think the logic would need to be changed for it to work correctly. I believe
currently, it just uses a document builder to parse the external file. to have
it work, we would need to load the contents of the file as a string and allow
JMeter to replace the variable. Then the sampler can parse the string content to
make a DOM document.

peter
